question: Who is a Brazilian footballer who last played for FC Goa of the Indian Super League as a central defender, who scored the winning goal  six minutes from full-time in a football match to determine the winners of the 2009 FIFA Confederations Cup?
context:
The 2009 FIFA Confederations Cup Final was a football match to determine the winners of the 2009 FIFA Confederations Cup. The match was held at Coca-Cola Park, Johannesburg, South Africa, on 28 June 2009 and was contested by the United States and Brazil. Despite being two goals down at half-time, Brazil won the match 3–2, with Lúcio scoring the winning goal six minutes from full-time.

Lucimar Ferreira da Silva (born 8 May 1978), commonly known as Lúcio, is a Brazilian footballer who last played for FC Goa of the Indian Super League as a central defender.
